Key Match Events: Alex Verdugo grounded into a game-ending double play in the first contest on Monday despite feeling confident against Yankees reliever Clay Holmes
The Sox took a 2-0 lead before Nick Pivetta blew up a one-hit shutout with 10 strikeouts by allowing three runs in the sixth inning
Pre-Game Insights: The teams were a combined 38 games out of first place when the day started
The Yankees are trying to avoid their first losing season since 1992 and owner Hal Steinbrenner has vowed to make changes in how the team operates
The Sox continue to plod through what could well be the final weeks of Chaim Bloomâ€™s tenure as chief baseball officer
Post-Match Reflections: The Sox have lost six of seven and are tied with the Yankees at the bottom of the division at 73-72
The best rivalry in baseball? Only in the history books these days.
Miscellaneous Highlights: There were plenty of empty seats for Game 1 of the Red Sox-Yankees doubleheader
The Sox announced an attendance of 30,029, which was based on tickets sold
The teams combined to start eight rookies in Game 1, a 3-2 victory for the Yankees
